column1: Taki is a city and a municipality under Hasnabad police station of Basirhat subdivision in North 24 Parganas district in the Indian state of West Bengal.
== Geography ==
Taki is located at 22.59°N 88.92°E﻿ / 22.59; 88.92. It has an average elevation of 5 metres (16 feet) at the bank of Ichamati River.
== Demographics ==
As per the 2011 Census of India
column2: Taki had a total population of 38
column6: 701 (49%) were females. Population below 6 years was 3
column7: 419. The total number of literates in Taki was 28
column8: 939 (83.05% of the population over 6 years).As of 2001 India census

column1: == Culture and education ==
There are a Library (Taki District Library) and a college named Taki Government College situated in Taki town. Taki Government High School
column2: is the oldest and of this area. Other renowned schools like Taki S. L. Girls High School and Taki Bhabanath High School are there. Ramakrishna Mission also established a branch with Taki Ramakrishna Mission High School and hostel facilities in Taki.

column1: Taki is known for its sweets called "Chhanar Malpoa". Other than local Kali Puja
column3: etc. this place became a tourist picnic spot beside the Ichamati river due to the international border between India and Bangladesh.

column1: Taki Government College was established in 1950. Affiliated to the West Bengal State University
column2: it offers honours courses in Bengali
column14: and a post-graduate course in Bengali.

column1: == Transport ==
Taki Road railway station is on the Barasat-Hasnabad line
column2: which is part of the Kolkata Suburban Railway system.State Highway 2 passes through Taki.

column1: == Healthcare ==
Taki Rural Hospital at Taki with 50 beds functions as the main medical facility in Hasnabad CD Block. There are primary health centres at Bhurkundu (Bhawanipur PHC with10 beds)
column2: Bhebia (Ghola PHC with 6 beds) and Bara Bankra (Barunhat PHC with 10).

column1: == Personalities ==
Independent India's first law minister Ashok Sen
column2: General Shankar Roychoudhury and former minister Gautam Deb hailed from Taki.
